column2: The fruit was so plentiful that young hobbits very nearly bathed in strawberries and cream...
column3: ''[[The Return of the King]]'', [[The Grey Havens]]}}
Strawberries]] in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]''

column1: '''Strawberries''' were wild berries found in several regions of [[Middle-earth]].
[[Bilbo Baggins]] tried to satisfy his hunger with wild strawberries growing near a stream in the upper Vales, as [[Thorin and Company]] escaped the [[Goblin-town]]<ref>{{h
During the last years of the [[Third Age]], strawberries were among the many fruits produced by [[The Shire]], and were enjoyed by the young [[Hobbits]].<ref>{{RK

[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s adventure in Switzerland in 1911 was his inspiration for the journey from [[Rivendell]] to the other side of the [[Misty Mountains]], and it is quite possible he consumed strawberries during this time.<ref>{{L
column2: 306}}</ref>. [[Michael Coren]] notes, "For dessert he liked a trifle or, in summer, strawberries with lots of cream."<ref>[[Michael Coren]], ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: The Man Who Created the Lord of the Rings]]'', "End Times"</ref>

column1: In ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: Artist and Illustrator]]'', No. 23 contains an illustration by J.R.R. Tolkien of a strawberry.
